alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Hocking; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHERN FAIRFIELD...NORTHWESTERN HOCKING...PICKAWAY AND NORTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Logan Elm Village, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Lancaster, Circleville, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ashville, South Bloomfield, Kingston, Williamsport, Logan Elm Village, Obetz, Royalton, Lithopolis, Fox, Amanda, Stoutsville, Clarksburg, Tarlton, Lockbourne, and Fairfield County Airport. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
